data.title: Obituary for TERRY LEE (LUCKY LAGGER) STEIGER
data.meta_description: Terry Lee Steiger “Lucky Lagger”, 48, of Troy MT, died on Monday Jan. 12, 2015, at his home in Troy.  Terry was born July 22, 1966 to Wilbert and Irene Steiger...
data.meta_site_name: Obituary for TERRY LEE (LUCKY LAGGER)  STEIGER
data.text:
Terry Lee Steiger “Lucky Lagger”, 48, of Troy MT, died on Monday Jan. 12, 2015, at his home in Troy. Terry was born July 22, 1966 to Wilbert and Irene Steiger in Bismarck ND. He moved with his family to Troy MT in 1967. He graduated from Troy High School class of 1984.

His first job was logging at the age of 15 he worked odd jobs till the age of 18 when he started working for Asarco. On September 14, 1985. Terry married Tami Morse and in no time later they had their first child Julie Ann Steiger, March 25, 1986; two years later they had their second child Thomas Lee Steiger, January 13, 1988. In 1997 Terry joined the Troy Volunteer Fire Department and was hired on with the Lincoln County Road Department. In 2014 due to Asbestosis he was forced into an early retirement. He enjoyed family, especially his grandchildren, friends, camping, Pepsi, Chevy’s, riding ATV’S, mechanicing, mudding, pulling out FordsJ, being a Fireman, and “walking the dogs”.

He was preceded in death by his parents Wilbert and Irene Steiger, a sister Evelyn and a brother Dale.

Survived By wife Tami Steiger, daughter Julie Steiger, son Thomas Steiger, daughter In-law Hope Vandelden, grandson Jeremy, granddaughter Grace; brothers Butch (Jolene), Allen (Brenda), Raymond, brother-in-law Jim, Sister Esther (Mike), Grandfather-in-law Lester, mother and father In law Christine and Ray; father-in-law Bruce; sister-in-laws Brenda (Roy), Riana (Jon); brother-In-laws Jim (Melissa), Jake (Misty), Anthony (Ashley), and numerous nieces and nephews

Services will be held at 2:00 p.m. on Saturday, January 24th, 2015 at the Troy Baptist Church. A potluck reception will be held after services at the Troy Baptist Church. Arrangements are by Schnackenberg & Nelson Funeral Home in Libby. Online condolences and memories may be shared at www.schnackenbergergfh.com.
